title: 89DB9367-7A84-44FD-AA6D-C701724F697E
important_topics: Scammers intercepting calls intended for banks using malware (Fake Call)
Chase's legal battles against glitch exploiting fraudsters
A payment app (Zelle) being weaponized for harassment
The importance of granting permissions to apps cautiously
Financial institutions needing to address system vulnerabilities and potential misuse of payment platforms
fraud_tips: Always use the official customer service number found directly on your bank's website or app.
Avoid search engines where scammers might plant fake listings.
Be cautious if you're asked for sensitive information, even if everything seems legit.
Review app permissions before granting them, ensuring they are relevant to the app's function.
Review privacy settings on payment apps and stay updated on new security features.
tactics: Scammers intercepting calls to banks by spoofing the bank's number and using malware.
Fraudsters exploiting technical loopholes in financial systems to generate unauthorized transactions (glitching).
Using payment apps like Zelle to send unwanted payments with abusive messages for harassment.
Downloading apps that contain malware which hijacks phone calls.
Planting fake listings on search engines to redirect customers to scammer call centers.
